\begin{frame}[fragile]
\frametitle{Simple columns}

\begin{columns}[T]
\column{0.47\textwidth}

\noindent\makebox[\textwidth][c]{\includegraphics[width=1.300\linewidth]{plot.png}}

\column{0.47\textwidth}
\begin{itemize}[<+-| alert@+>]

\item bullet 1

\item bullet 2

\item bullet 3
\end{itemize}

\end{columns}
\end{frame}

\begin{frame}[fragile]
\frametitle{Explicit columns}

\begin{columns}[T]
\column{0.75\textwidth}

\noindent\makebox[\textwidth][c]{\includegraphics[height=0.75\textheight]{plot.png}}

\column{0.20\textwidth}
\begin{itemize}[<+-| alert@+>]

\item bullet 1

\item bullet 2

\item bullet 3
\end{itemize}

\end{columns}
\end{frame}

\begin{frame}[fragile]
\frametitle{A slide without columns}


Just to make sure our ``columnization'' isn't persistent, this should show up
up as a plain normal slide.
\end{frame}
